alert.note: Alert for Gila; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 17 at 8:56PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MST FOR SOUTH OF PAYSON...NEAR RYE AND JAKES CORNER THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Areas south of Payson...near Rye...Jakes Corner and other parts of southern Gila and eastern Yavapai Counties. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 PM MST, Gauge reports indicated a slight rise of 1 foot along the Tonto Creek south of Jakes Corner. Additional quick river and creek rises may cause minor flooding in Tonto Creek. Doppler Radar estimates that between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Tonto Creek is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... South Prong Sycamore Creek, Red Creek, Deadman Creek, Cold Water Creek, Little Lime Creek, Brushy Creek, Hardscrabble Creek, Davenport Wash, Middle Red Creek, Dry Creek, Gap Creek, Horse Creek, Spring Wash, Houston Creek, North Fork Deadman Creek, Tangle Creek, Fossil Creek, Ash Spring Creek, Pigeon Creek, Dry Wash, Bishop Creek, South Fork Deadman Creek, Wet Bottom Creek, Verde River, Sycamore Creek, Lime Creek and Professor Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Payson, Star Valley, Rye, Oxbow Estates, Gisela, Round Valley, Jakes Corner, East Verde Estates, Mesa Del Caballo, Flowing Springs, Horseshoe Reservoir, Childs Power Plant, Deer Creek, Houston Mesa Campground, Tonto Natural Bridge State Park, Reynolds Creek Group Campground and Rose Creek Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 252 and 257. State Route 288 near mile marker 276...and between mile markers 278 and 287...and between mile markers 292 and 293. State Route 188 between mile markers 267 and 276. State Route 87 southbound between mile markers 241 and 251. State Route 87 between mile markers 230 and 263. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
